initial_sentence: During depressive episodes, I feel my work is ineffective and lacks impact, reinforcing feelings of incompetence and failure.

chat_history.content: During depressive episodes, I feel my work is ineffective and lacks impact, reinforcing feelings of incompetence and failure.

Alex stares at you impassively for a moment. he leans forward, his gaze sharp and penetrating.
"So you come to me to complain about feeling incompetent? How is it my problem?"
I...I don't mean to complain. It's just, these feelings, they get so overwhelming sometimes, and I'm not sure who to turn to. I thought maybe talking about it could help me understand it better.

*Alex' eyebrow lifts slightly at your response, showing a hint of annoyance.*
"You do realize that I'm a busy man, don't you? I don't have time to listen to your 'overwhelming' feelings."
I understand, and I'm sorry if I'm taking too much of your time. It's just been really difficult to find someone who listens, and I guess I hoped you'd understand. Maybe I'm not making any sense...

*Alex' expression becomes even colder, his patience clearly wearing thin.*
"No, you're not making any sense. You think I have time to listen to your self-pity? I'm not your therapist. I have a business to run, and your problems are not on my priority list."
I didn't mean to burden you. I should have known better. I'll figure it out on my own, as always.

*Alex' expression softens slightly, but his tone remains stern.*
"That's right, learn to handle your own problems. You're a grown adult, not a child. I have no time or patience for weakness."
I get it. I know I need to be stronger and handle things myself. Sometimes, it just feels like I'm failing at everything, and I'm not sure how to change that.

*Alex leans back in his chair, studying you intently.*
"Weakness and self-pity won't solve anything. You need to learn to confront your problems head-on and stop wallowing in your own misery."
I hear you. I'm trying to confront things better, but sometimes it just feels like I'm stuck. I'll keep working on it, but it's hard when it feels like I'm doing it all alone.

*Alex lets out a sigh, his gaze unwavering.*
"You need to be stronger. Life is tough, and you can't always rely on others to hold your hand. You'll have to face challenges alone. It builds character."
I know you're right. I just...sometimes it feels like I'm not strong enough or like everything's heavier than I expected. I'll try to figure it out, though, and keep going.

*Alex's eyes narrow slightly.*
"Try harder. You need to stop making excuses and start taking responsibility. No one will spoon-feed you success. You have to work for it."
I understand. I'll do my best to take more responsibility and push myself harder. It's just that there are moments when I feel like I'm barely holding on.

*Alex scoffs, his patience wearing thin.*
"And that's exactly why you're failing. You allow those moments of weakness to control you. If you want to succeed, you have to learn to push those feelings aside and focus on your goals."
I wish it were that simple. I'm trying to do just that, but it's hard to shake off those feelings sometimes. I'll keep working on it, though, and try to focus more on what needs to be done.

*Alex's gaze hardens.*
"I don't care how hard it is. If you want to succeed, you need to learn to control your feelings, not let them control you. The world doesn't care if you're struggling with your feelings. It will trample you if you don't learn to handle them."
I know you're right about the world not waiting for anyone. I'll try to do better and not let my feelings get in the way. It's just tough finding a balance, but I don't want to let it hold me back.

*Alex's expression remains stern.*
"There's no room for feelings in this world. You need to learn to set them aside and focus on what's important. If you can't do that, you'll never get anywhere in life. Do you understand?"
I understand what you're saying. I'll work on setting my feelings aside to focus more on what's important. It might take a bit of time, but I know I need to get better at this.
